Question_1.Context: Staphylococcus aureus is a bacterium that can cause a range of illnesses from minor infections to life-threatening diseases. It is important to have methods for its detection and isolation.
Question_1.Question: What is the significance of developing rapid and reliable technologies for the detection and identification of Staphylococcus aureus?
Question_1.B: To enhance the early identification and treatment of infectious illnesses
Question_1.C: To increase the speed of computer processors
Question_1.Source: The ability to quickly and accurately analyze Staphylococcus aureus (S. aureus) and isolate the bacteria in a simplified setting is crucial for the early identification and treatment of infectious illnesses.

Question_2.Context: In the context of molecular biology, rolling circle amplification is a process that can amplify DNA with a repetitive sequence.
Question_2.Question: What is the purpose of using rolling circle amplification in the context of detecting Staphylococcus aureus?
Question_2.A: To decrease the sensitivity of detection
Question_2.B: To reduce the cost of DNA sequencing
Question_2.C: To build a detection scaffold with a repetitive functional hairpin structure
Question_2.D: To simplify the protein synthesis process
Question_2.Source: This technique uses a rolling circle amplification procedure to build a detection scaffold with a repetitive functional hairpin structure that, upon identifying S. aureus, can launch a catalytic hairpin assembly-mediated DNAzyme-based cascade signal amplification.

Question_3.Context: Catalytic hairpin assembly is a technique used in molecular biology for signal amplification.
Question_3.Question: What role does catalytic hairpin assembly play in the detection of Staphylococcus aureus?
Question_3.A: It decreases the specificity of the detection method
Question_3.B: It is used to reduce the detection time
Question_3.C: It serves as a method for DNA repair
Question_3.D: It enhances the sensitivity of the detection technique
Question_3.Source: This technique uses a rolling circle amplification procedure to build a detection scaffold with a repetitive functional hairpin structure that, upon identifying S. aureus, can launch a catalytic hairpin assembly-mediated DNAzyme-based cascade signal amplification.

Question_4.Context: Aptamers are oligonucleotide sequences that can bind to specific targets with high affinity and specificity.
Question_4.Question: What is the function of aptamers in the context of detecting Staphylococcus aureus?
Question_4.A: To catalyze the breakdown of bacterial cell walls
Question_4.B: To serve as a nutrient source for bacteria
Question_4.C: To bind to protein A with high affinity and specificity
Question_4.D: To inhibit the replication of bacterial DNA
Question_4.Source: The Protein A aptamer is a short oligonucleotide sequence discovered through in vitro screening that can bind to protein A with high affinity and specificity by forming a unique molecular conformation.

Question_5.B: To cleave reporter probes and release fluorescent signals

Question_7.Context: In molecular detection techniques, the limit of detection (LOD) is an important measure of the method's sensitivity.

Question_8.A: Due to the high temperature used during detection
